member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient
member.summary:
A class that represents a single gRPC connection which can be used to handle gNMI communication. This requires the CommunicationGateway DxM to be available.
'Channel' refers to a virtual connection to a conceptual endpoint in the DxM. 'Connection' refers to an active gRPC (HTTP2) connection with an endpoint. 'DataSource' refers to a conceptual endpoint and its identifying parameters. 'Node' refers to a location in the OpenConfig schema, represented by a path. A node can be a leaf, a container, a list, etc.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._mwClient
member.summary: The middleware client instance that will handle the DxM communication. A member defined as an interface is used to make unit testing easier.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._dataMapper
member.summary: An optional object that can be set on a client which will take care of processing and executing an action on the notification.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient._supportedEncodings
member.summary: The data encodings supported by the target ordered by a certain preference. Will be initialized automatically when connecting with the target. The most preferred encoding in the list will be used for all GetRequest messages. If it is not possible to retrieve the supported encodings or the target does not return any, will be used.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.#ctor(System.UInt32,System.UInt32,System.String,Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.DataSourceConfiguration,Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.Common.Api.ILogger)
member.summary: Constructs a gNMI/gRPC client that will use the CommunicationGateway DxM to connect to a device. The connection is only set up when Connect() is called.
member.param: The DataMiner agent ID of the element if applicable. Becomes part of the channel ID and helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces.
The element ID of the element if applicable. Becomes part of the channel ID and helps identify the source when investigating logging and traces.
A descriptive name for this channel, to differentiate the logging if multiple channels are logging to the same file.
The details needed to find and connect to the endpoint.
The interface that will be called for any logging.
member.exception: The channelName should not be or empty or whitespace.
The value should be a NATS token-friendly name.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.#ctor(Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.CommunicationGatewayMiddleware.OpenConfig.Api.IOpenConfigClient)
member.summary: Constructor for unit tests where the middleware client instance can be mocked.
member.param: The middleware client that handles the OpenConfig requests.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.Get(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Double)
member.summary: Get the gNMI values for the specified paths.
member.param: The paths to request. A path should be formatted as a concatenation of node names separated by either a forward or backward slash.
Timeout in seconds for the request to complete. Default: 5 seconds.
member.returns: The individual response values, this is usually one value per path. Can only be iterated once.
member.exception: The input argument cannot be .
There should be at least one path present.
An exception was thrown by the DxM.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.Get(System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Gnmi.Path},System.Double)
member.summary: Get the gNMI values for the specified paths.
member.param: The paths to request. This uses the actual gNMI Path class.
Timeout in seconds for the request to complete. Default: 5 seconds.
member.returns: The individual response values, this is usually one value per path. Can only be iterated once.
member.exception: The input argument cannot be .
There should be at least one path present.
An exception was thrown by the DxM.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.Subscribe(System.String,System.TimeSpan,System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{System.String},System.Action{System.Collections.Generic.IEnumerable{Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Models.GnmiResponseValue}})
member.summary: Adds a subscription with a sample interval on the endpoint for the specified paths.
member.param: An identifying name for this subscription. The name must be unique for the channel or the request will be ignored if already active.
Interval between samples. Assign zero to receive at the lowest interval possible.
The model paths to subscribe to. A path should be formatted as a concatenation of node names separated by either a forward or backward slash.
The callback action to execute when an update is received.
member.exception: The action argument cannot be when there is no DataMapper present.
The sampleInterval argument cannot be negative.
Name of the subscription cannot be , empty, or a whitespace.
The paths argument cannot be .
There should be at least one path present in the paths argument.
An exception was thrown by the DxM.

member.summary: Adds a subscription with a sample interval on the endpoint for the specified paths.
member.param: An identifying name for this subscription. The name must be unique for the channel or the request will be ignored if already active.
Interval between samples. Assign zero to receive at the lowest interval possible.
The model paths to subscribe to. A path should be formatted as a concatenation of node names separated by either a forward or backward slash.
When true, only values that changed during the interval will be sent.
Alters the suppress-redundant behavior and sets an interval at which values should be sent even if they did not change. Value cannot be negative and TimeSpan.Zero disables the feature.
The callback action to execute when an update is received.
member.exception: The action argument cannot be when there is no DataMapper present.
The sampleInterval argument cannot be negative.
The heartbeatInterval argument cannot be negative.

The paths argument cannot be .
There should be at least one path present in the paths argument.
An exception was thrown by the DxM.

member.summary: Adds a subscription for changed values on the endpoint for the specified paths.
member.param: An identifying name for this subscription. The name must be unique for the channel or the request will be ignored if already active.
The model paths to subscribe to. A path should be formatted as a concatenation of node names separated by either a forward or backward slash.
The callback action to execute when an update is received.
The TARGET_DEFINED mode lets the server decide for each leaf of the subscribed nodes whether it should use an ON_CHANGE or SAMPLE subscription.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Api.GnmiClient.Set(System.String,System.String,Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType,System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the value for a specific path.
member.param: The node path to set. This should be a leaf node unless the contentType is JSON and the data source supports this.
The string value to set.

Format of the parameter. It can be one of the following enum values: - StringValue means that the value parameter is a plain string. - AsciiString means that the value parameter is a plain ASCII string. - JsonUtf8 means that the value parameter is a JSON-encoded string that will be sent to the data source in UTF-8 encoding. - JsonIetfUtf8 means that the value parameter is a JSON-encoded string that follows the RFC8259 standard and will be sent to the data source in UTF-8 encoding.
Timeout in seconds for the request to complete. Default: 5 seconds.
member.exception: The path argument cannot be , empty, or a whitespace.
Argument contentType contains a type that is not supported.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.DataValueOriginType
member.summary: Indicates where the value originated from.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.DataValueOriginType.Unknown
member.summary: Not known where the entered data came from.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.DataValueOriginType.Poll
member.summary: Data entered through polling.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.DataValueOriginType.Subscription
member.summary: Data entered through subscription.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.PathFilterResultType
member.summary: Result after filtering out the root path.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.PathFilterResultType.NoMatch
member.summary: There is no match between the entity path and the data path.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.PathFilterResultType.ExactMatch
member.summary: There was an exact match between the entity path and the data path. The token value is the needed value for the data entity.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.PathFilterResultType.PartialMatch
member.summary: The data path matches but is smaller than the entity path. Further exploration of the token value is needed to have a match. The value needed for the entity will be a child token of the token value.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.PathFilterResultType.LongerDataMatch
member.summary: The data path matches but is longer than the entity path. The data value is for a child of the entity.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType
member.summary: To be used in combination with a string parameter. This is an indication of the format of the string parameter.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType.StringValue
member.summary: The passed string content represents a string.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType.AsciiString
member.summary: The passed string content represents ASCII text.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType.JsonUtf8
member.summary: The passed string content represents a JSON-encoded text. The text will be encoded as UTF-8 when it is sent to the data source.

member.name: F:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Enums.StringValueContentType.JsonIetfUtf8
member.summary: The passed string content represents a JSON-encoded text per RFC7951. The text will be encoded as UTF-8 when it is sent to the data source.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Models.GnmiResponseValue.TimestampRawEpoch
member.summary: Gets the associated timestamp of the value in nanoseconds since Epoch. Usage of this property is recommended only when using Subscribe, not Get.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Models.GnmiResponseValue.TimestampUtc
member.summary: Gets the associated timestamp of the value in UTC time format. Usage of this property is recommended only when using Subscribe, not Get.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Models.GnmiResponseValue.Value
member.summary: The value as one of the corresponding base types: * null * bool * ulong * long * double * string * byte[]
member.exception: When the underlying type is not recognized, this exception will throw what type is detected.

member.name: P:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Models.GnmiResponseValue.ValueType
member.summary: Returns the parsed value type, this will return one of these expected types: * null * bool * ulong * long * double * string * byte[]
member.exception: When the underlying type is not recognized, this exception will throw what type is detected.

member.name: T:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils
member.summary: Some utilities to parse or format gNMI items.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.ConvertPathToString(Gnmi.Path,Gnmi.Path,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts two gNMI Path objects into a single path string.
member.param: The first path acting as a prefix.
The second path to append after the prefix.
Includes keys in the output when a path contains those.
member.returns: A path string containing the path node names separated by a forward slash '/'.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.ConvertPathToString(Gnmi.Path,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a gNMI Path object into a path string.
member.param: The path to format.
Includes keys in the output when a path contains those.
member.returns: A path string containing the path node names separated by a forward slash '/'.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.ConvertPathToStringLimited(Gnmi.Path,System.Int32,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Converts a limited gNMI PathElem object into a path string.
member.param: The path to convert.
The number of path elements to be included in the result.
Boolean indicating if the path element keys need to be added.
member.returns: A path string containing the path node names separated by a forward slash '/'.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.FindLastKeyOccurrenceInPath(Gnmi.Path)
member.summary:
Finds the last occurrence of a key in a certain path.
A path should typically only contain one key but in case there are multiple, it will return the one of the deepest child node.
member.param: The path that needs to be searched in.
member.returns: The key that is found in the path.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.MergePaths(Gnmi.Path,Gnmi.Path)
member.summary: Merges two paths into one path.
member.param: First path to be merged.
Second path to be merged.
member.returns: Path containing the merged paths.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.RemoveCommonPathElements(Gnmi.Path,Gnmi.Path,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Removes the entity path from the data path.
member.param: Path as defined on the data entity.
Path as present in the incoming data.
Indication if all keys specified in the entity and data need to match exactly.
member.returns: Result after filtering the entity path.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.HasCommonPathElements(Gnmi.Path,Gnmi.Path)
member.summary: Validates if the entity path and the data path have common path elements.
member.param: Path as defined on the data entity.
Path as present in the incoming data.
member.returns: Boolean indicating if the entity path and data path have common path elements.

member.summary: Parses the provided string paths into gNMI Path objects.
member.param: The string paths to parse.
member.returns: A gNMI Path object for each enumerated string.

member.name: M:Skyline.DataMiner.DataSources.OpenConfig.Gnmi.Utils.GnmiUtils.GetValueByCase(Gnmi.TypedValue,System.Boolean)
member.summary: Given a gNMI TypedValue, will return the appropriate object type with the parsed value.
member.param: The value to parse.
Indicates if a bool value needs to be converted into an int.
member.returns: The value contained in an appropriate type: string, bool, double, long, ulong, byte[], or object when null.
member.exception: When the underlying type is not recognized, this exception will throw what type is detected.

member.param: Full path.
Prefix path to be verified against the full path.
Index position where the full path further continues.
member.returns: Boolean indicating if the fullPath starts with the prefixPath.

member.summary: Converts a path as string into a gNMI path.

member.returns: gNMI path.

member.summary: Converts a gNMI into a format that gets forwarded to the consumer.
member.param: The gNMI subscribe response that needs to be converted.
member.returns: A list of gNMI responses in a specific format that gets forwarded to a consumer.

member.summary: Tries to get the path origin from the string path. A path origin is located at the start of the string path and ends with ':/'.
member.param: Path as string.
Found path origin.
Index position after the origin.
member.returns: Boolean indicating if the string path starts with a path origin.

member.summary: Gets the start position of the next path.

Position to start looking for the next path.

member.summary: Gets the end position of a value.
member.param: Path as string.
Position to start looking for the end of the value.
member.returns: Position in the stringPath where the value ends. This is the position of the closing single quote or -1 when not found.

member.summary: Provide a cached reusable instance of StringBuilder per thread.

member.name: M:System.Text.StringBuilderCache.Acquire(System.Int32)
member.summary: Get a StringBuilder for the specified capacity.
member.remarks: If a StringBuilder of an appropriate size is cached, it will be returned and the cache emptied.

member.summary: Place the specified builder in the cache if it is not too big.
